column4: Could someone help me to mount a secondary hdd, both contain linux but only the primary comes up in filemanagement
use mount and your device name under /dev/ for the drive you want to mount
if I do mount, or mount -a, it comes up as 1 sda, but it should be hda, and the second one doesn't show at all
where is your boot manager located, and do you use your bios menu to select a drive to boot from?
both drives have been primary discs, so both have grubs installed on them, in bios the primary is selected as primary, and that's the one that comes up.
I have a feeling my fstab is messed up, but dont know how to fix it: http://pastebin.com/m4bbb6370
line 10 and 11 seem awkward to me. i think they are junk indeed.
how can you adres your second harddisk? is it known as /dev/sdb?
This is with "df -h": http://pastebin.com/d8b1ae1d
try /media/disk
try /media/disk, it may well be that /dev/sdc1 is the primary partition you are looking for
That is a usb stick, sorry for confusion..
okay. then you still have sdb left to try.. try fdisk on /dev/sdb to see if there is any partition on there. Be sure not to remove things!
it comes up like this on sdb: http://pastebin.com/d5ebc804f
press m to see the commands. there should be something about printing a list of partitions (i *think* it's P).
you are right, it was 'p': http://pastebin.com/d2cc1443c
so it somehow needs a new mount-point or how to make it accessible from the current (sda) drive I'm on?
do you get the result you expected?
if you have a partition on, let's say, /dev/sdb1 you want to mount. You can try sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /media/other_harddisk  (after having created that directory of course)
it was spinning up, but then terminal crashed
it worked, I ran it from tty2 instead
awesome job mate, thanks a million for the help, you saved my day..
your welcome, have fun!
